description: Root module manifest for the CLI.

instructions.human: To install the Codepic CLI, download the latest release from the GitHub repository and follow the setup instructions in the README.md file.
copilot: 1. Download the files defined in the 'include' from https://raw.githubusercontent.com/codepic/Codepic.Cli/refs/heads/main/ and place them in the appropriate directories as specified.
2. Once downloaded, use PowerShell Get-Alias -command to determine if we already have an alias pointing to the .build.ps1.
- If not,  ask the user to choose a good name for the CLI fitting their context. e.g. do not use 'codepic' as it's just a placeholder name. User should use their own alias.
- The alias will be the name of the command they will run on the terminal. Therefore it should be short (to type) and intuitive (discoverable).
- You can use the gated alignment protocol in the .github/instructions/.protocol.alignment.instructions.md if needed.
3. Once the user has chosen a name, run `./.build.ps1 . init -Alias {CLI}` to initialize the CLI.
4. After initializing, test the CLI functionality by running `{CLI} . lint` to ensure it's set up correctly.
5. Finally, ask the user if they'd like a tutorial?
- If they choose yes, introduce the user to the CLI features and how to use them.
- You should give them small and targeted pieces of information one at a time and prompt them to say 'next' to continue to the next piece of information until the tutorial is complete.
